name: 12 Minute Thai Chicken Peanut Noodles
description: Recipe video above. Thai Chicken Peanut Noodles is what you make when you've got less than 15 minutes to get dinner on the table and you need a Thai fix! Using chicken mince means no meat prep - and you can switch it out with literally any ground meat (beef, turkey, pork). It might not be authentic Thai ... but it's fast and 100% delicious!
recipeIngredient: <val>3/4</val> cup coconut milk (~1/2 a can, full fat for best flavour)
<val>2</val>  instant ramen or noodle cakes (~70-100g/2.5-3.5oz per cake; any brand, discard seasoning pack)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Add garlic and cook for 20 seconds until it turns golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Add garlic and cook for 20 seconds until it turns golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chicken mince and cook for 2 minutes, breaking it up as you go, until it mostly changes from pink to white.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chicken mince and cook for 2 minutes, breaking it up as you go, until it mostly changes from pink to white.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1 tbsp red curry paste, curry powder and soy sauce. Cook for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1 tbsp red curry paste, curry powder and soy sauce. Cook for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Clear a space in the middle of the pan, add remaining 1/2 tbsp curry paste, stir the curry paste for 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Clear a space in the middle of the pan, add remaining 1/2 tbsp curry paste, stir the curry paste for 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chicken stock, bring to a simmer then reduce to medium-high. Simmer for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chicken stock, bring to a simmer then reduce to medium-high. Simmer for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Squish the noodle cakes in, pushing chicken aside so the noodles are as submerged as possible.
recipeInstructions.name: Squish the noodle cakes in, pushing chicken aside so the noodles are as submerged as possible.

recipeInstructions.text: Leave to cook for 45 seconds, then flip noodles. Leave for another 30 seconds, then separate the noodles with 2 wooden spoons.
recipeInstructions.name: Leave to cook for 45 seconds, then flip noodles. Leave for another 30 seconds, then separate the noodles with 2 wooden spoons.

recipeInstructions.text: Push noodles aside, add coconut milk, peanut butter and vinegar, then give it a quick mix to mostly dissolve the peanut butter.
recipeInstructions.name: Push noodles aside, add coconut milk, peanut butter and vinegar, then give it a quick mix to mostly dissolve the peanut butter.

recipeInstructions.text: Add spinach, toss with the noodles for 30 seconds until wilted. Make sure it's still pretty saucy - everybody loves sauce!
recipeInstructions.name: Add spinach, toss with the noodles for 30 seconds until wilted. Make sure it's still pretty saucy - everybody loves sauce!

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to serving bowls, sprinkle with coriander, peanuts and Sriracha or chilli paste if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to serving bowls, sprinkle with coriander, peanuts and Sriracha or chilli paste if desired.

keywords: chicken mince recipe, Peanut noodles, ramen recipe
